vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-22475
vulnerabilities.description: "Tasks" application version before 9.7.3 is affected by insecure permissions. The VoiceCommandActivity application component allows arbitrary applications on a device to add tasks with no restrictions.
`glob-parent` before 5.1.2 has a regular expression denial of service vulnerability. The enclosure regex used to check for strings ending in enclosure containing path separator.

references.source: Advisory 1751: Regular expression denial of service

vulnerabilities.name: CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption ('Resource Exhaustion')
vulnerabilities.description: The software does not properly restrict the size or amount of resources that are requested or influenced by an actor, which can be used to consume more resources than intended.

`lodash` versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Command Injection via the template function.

vulnerabilities.name: CWE-77: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
vulnerabilities.description: The software constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

vulnerabilities.description: Affected versions of `path-parse` are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via splitDeviceRe, splitTailRe, and splitPathRe regular expressions. ReDoS exhibits polynomial worst-case time complexity.

vulnerabilities.description: `ssri` 5.2.2-6.0.1 and 7.0.0-7.1.1, processes SRIs using a regular expression which is vulnerable to a denial of service. Malicious SRIs could take an extremely long time to process, leading to denial of service. This issue only affects consumers using the strict option.

vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-32640
vulnerabilities.description: ws is an open source WebSocket client and server library for Node.js. A specially crafted value of the `Sec-Websocket-Protocol` header can be used to significantly slow down a ws server. The vulnerability has been fixed in ws@7.4.6 (https://github.com/websockets/ws/commit/00c425ec77993773d823f018f64a5c44e17023ff). In vulnerable versions of ws, the issue can be mitigated by reducing the maximum allowed length of the request headers using the [`--max-http-header-size=size`](https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#cli_max_http_header_size_size) and/or the [`maxHeaderSize`](https://nodejs.org/api/http.html#http_http_createserver_options_requestlistener) options.
